intro: Fuscospora fusca, commonly known as the black-spored moss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Dicranaceae. It is characterized by its dark, almost black spores that are produced in elongated capsules. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. Its leaves are narrow and gradually taper to a point, with a distinct midrib. Fuscospora fusca plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for small invertebrates in its native ecosystems.
